physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient appeared ill; lethargic but cooperative. Hemorrhagic cellulitis of the left lower leg without regional lymphadenopathy was observed.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: By the morning after admission, the patient's temperature had risen to 39.8 °C, and the hemorrhagic cellulitis was rapidly progressing.
Humor again noted, subsequent emergent fasciotomy performed due to progression.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Hemorrhagic and infected soft tissues led to left transfemoral amputation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient gradually improved and regained full consciousness 4 days after transfemoral amputation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Development of right hemiparesis without hypotensive episodes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: CT scan revealed low-density areas indicating cerebritis.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Neck stiffness, aphasia, and loss of consciousness observed.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: CT scans revealed left fronto-temporal hemorrhage.
